footer.description: Monitoring your brand’s visibility across AI models

meta.version: Version: {date} — Effective as of this date

intro.p1: This policy (the 'Policy') describes the processing of personal data carried out by MAJ Holding Sàrl ('MAJ', 'we', 'our') in connection with the VOXUM service available at https://voxum.maj.digital (the 'Site/Service').
intro.p2: Controller: MAJ Holding Sàrl, Ch. Bois-Gentil 7, 1203 Geneva, Switzerland. IDE/CHE: CHE-391.786.123. Contact: info@maj.digital
intro.p3: By accessing the Site/Service, you ('User', 'you') agree that your personal data will be processed in accordance with this Policy. We may modify the Policy; in case of material changes, we will inform you appropriately. If you do not accept the changes, stop using the Site/Service. This Policy complements our Terms of Service.

overview.p1: VOXUM performs brand positioning analyses by querying AI providers and search tools (OpenAI, Anthropic/Claude, Perplexity, Firecrawl, Google) based on predefined prompts. We intermediate requests to third parties and aggregate their responses to provide reports.
overview.li1: Data minimization: only data necessary for Service execution is collected.
overview.li2: We do not use your data to train our models. Where providers offer no-training parameters, we enable them when available.
overview.li3: Third-party providers are responsible for their own processing and policies.
overview.p2: We process your data under Swiss nFADP and, where applicable, the GDPR.

data.li1: Account & identification: first name, last name, organization, role, email, phone.
data.li2: Billing & contracts: billing address, country, VAT/IDE, payment methods (via provider), histories.
data.li3: Operational content: prompts, keywords, brand/product lists, contexts, uploaded files.
data.li4: Support: messages, tickets, demo recordings (with consent), preferences.
data.li5: Technical data & logs: IP, timestamps, URLs, session identifiers, user-agent, performance, security.
data.h33: 2.3 Data from public sources and providers
data.li7: Public content via Firecrawl/Google (web pages, search results).
data.li8: AI model outputs generated from your prompts.
data.note: Customer responsibility: if you provide us with third-party data, you warrant you have a legal basis and adequate information.

bases.li2: Legitimate interests: security, fraud/abuse prevention, Service improvement, aggregated analytics, legal defense, internal management.
bases.li4: Consent: marketing emails, non-essential cookies, demo recordings.
bases.p1: Technical & organizational measures: encryption, access control, logging, testing, key management. Anonymization/pseudonymization where appropriate (objection per legal basis).

purposes.li1: Provide the Service: execute requests, orchestrate calls to providers, deliver reports, maintenance, support.
purposes.li2: Billing & customer management: contracts, payments (via provider), collections, operational communications.
purposes.li3: Security: abuse detection, account protection, continuity.
purposes.li4: Product improvement: usage measurement, testing, prompt quality.
purposes.li5: B2B marketing (with consent): newsletter, events, content.
purposes.li6: Compliance: legal obligations, authority requests, defense of rights.

sharing.p1: We do not sell your data. Sharing only with:
sharing.li1: Subprocessors: Vercel, Neon (Postgres), Stripe (payments), UseAutumn (subscriptions), OpenAI, Anthropic/Claude, Perplexity, Firecrawl, Google (APIs/Analytics), hosting/monitoring/email/anti-abuse.
sharing.li2: Independent controllers as applicable: some providers for their own purposes (security, compliance).
sharing.li3: Authorities & advisors: legal obligations, rights protection, financing/transaction operations (under adequate NDAs).
sharing.p2: Transparency: subprocessor list available on request; prior notice for material changes where required.

transfers.p1: Hosting primarily in Switzerland/EU (notably via Neon). Transfers outside Switzerland/EU/EEA (e.g., United States) may occur if necessary to perform the Service. Safeguards: SCCs (EU 2021/914) adapted to Swiss law and appropriate supplementary measures. By providing your data, you consent to such transfers as permitted by law.

retention.li3: Prompts & outputs: by default 12 months (configurable/shortenable upon request).
retention.li4: Technical logs: 12 months (up to 24 months in case of abuse).
retention.li5: Marketing: until consent withdrawal or 24 months of inactivity.
retention.p1: Anonymized data may be retained longer for statistical purposes.

cookies.li3: Audience measurement: Google Analytics (aggregated statistics). Opt-out possible via consent banner and browser.
cookies.p1: Refusing certain cookies may limit functionalities. See dedicated Cookies Policy where applicable.

rights.li2: Portability (if applicable), restriction, objection (legitimate interest/direct marketing).
rights.li3: Withdrawal of consent at any time (no retroactive effect).
rights.p1: Exercise your rights: info@maj.digital. Right to lodge a complaint: FDPIC (Switzerland) or your local EU authority.

security.p1: Proportionate measures: encryption, segmentation, least privilege, vulnerability management, backups, logging, subprocessor review. No security is absolute; follow good practices (strong passwords, 2FA, caution with exports).

roles.li1: MAJ is controller for account data, billing, Site usage, and orchestration of requests.
roles.li2: MAJ is processor for third-party personal data provided to produce analyses (DPA available on request).
roles.li3: You remain responsible for the lawfulness of data you enter and informing data subjects where required.
roles.p1: AI outputs may contain errors; we limit inclusion of unnecessary personal data and honor deletion requests when possible and lawful.

children.p1: B2B service; not intended for persons under 16. If collected inadvertently, contact us for deletion.

contact.p1: MAJ Holding Sàrl – VOXUM Email: privacy@maj.digital Address: Ch. Bois-Gentil 7, 1203 Geneva, Switzerland

stripe.name: Stripe
stripe.data: Name, email, billing address, customer IDs, metadata and payment tokens

autumn.data: Account identifiers, email, subscription state, plan metadata

nav.aria: Terms of Service table of contents

general.p1: These Terms of Service (the 'Terms') apply to any use of the VOXUM website and services available at https://voxum.maj.digital (the 'Service'), provided by MAJ Holding Sàrl (CHE-391.786.123), Ch. Bois-Gentil 7, 1203 Geneva ('we', 'us' or 'VOXUM').
general.p2: Any use of the Service by a user ('you' or 'User') constitutes acceptance of these Terms. If you use the Service on behalf of a legal entity, you confirm you are authorized to bind it and you accept these Terms on its behalf.
general.p3: We may modify these Terms at any time; you will be informed appropriately. Any subsequent use constitutes acceptance of the updated Terms.
general.p4: Some services (payments, API, integrations) may be subject to specific terms in addition to these Terms.

personal.p1: By using the Service, you confirm you are at least 18 years old and, where applicable, authorized to act for the legal entity on whose behalf you use the Service.

access.p1: Equipment and telecommunication fees required to access the Service are at your expense.
access.p2: Internet use involves risks (interception, loss, viruses). You accept these risks; we disclaim any resulting liability to the extent permitted by law.

features.p1: VOXUM enables professional users to analyze their brand visibility across AI models and third-party search engines (OpenAI, Anthropic/Claude, Perplexity, Google, etc.) and obtain aggregated reports.
features.p2: Some services are paid according to the displayed plans. Orders and payments are handled via our payment provider; additional commercial terms are set out in the applicable documents (e.g., billing).
features.p3: Prices are shown in EUR/CHF depending on context; they may change. Taxes and additional fees may apply depending on the country.

ip.p1: Subject to user content (sec. 5.3) and third-party elements (models, APIs), VOXUM and its licensors own all intellectual property rights to the Service and its content.
ip.p2: License: a personal, revocable, non-exclusive and non-transferable license is granted to you to use the Service strictly under these Terms.
ip.p3: User content: you retain your rights over content you submit. You grant us a worldwide, non-exclusive, free and transferable license to host, process, display and reproduce such content to operate the Service. We may remove any unlawful content or content contrary to the Terms.

restrictions.p1: Prohibited notably: (i) massive extraction or reuse of content (scraping/crawling), (ii) attempting to access source code, (iii) using the Service for unlawful activities, (iv) circumventing our usage limits, (v) using the Service to train models or evaluate individuals, unless agreed in writing.

privacy.p1: Our Privacy Policy forms an integral part of these Terms and describes personal data processing: /privacy.

changes.p1: We may modify, suspend or stop all or part of the Service, with or without notice, without liability, within legal limits.

warranty.p1: The Service is provided 'as is' and 'as available'. No warranty of accuracy, availability or fitness for a particular purpose is given. AI model outputs may contain errors; you remain responsible for their use.

liability.p1: To the extent permitted by law, we disclaim liability for indirect or consequential damages (loss of profit, data, opportunity). Total liability, if any, is capped at amounts paid for the Service over the last 12 months.

indemnification.p1: You will indemnify VOXUM against any claim arising from your breach of the Terms, law, or third-party rights.

misc.p1: Severability: invalidity of a clause does not affect the rest. Assignment: you may not assign your rights without our consent; we may assign the Service. Force majeure: we are not liable for force majeure events.

law.p1: Swiss law applies; exclusive venue in Geneva, subject to mandatory venue.

contact.p1: Contact: info@maj.digital — MAJ Holding Sàrl, Ch. Bois-Gentil 7, 1203 Geneva, Switzerland.

objectif.title: Tool Objective
objectif.p1: Accelerate brand/product discovery, comparison and recommendations by combining real-time web search and AI analysis, while keeping outputs structured and actionable for the team (Marketing, Growth, Product, Procurement).

results.title: Expected results
results.li1: Up-to-date relevant brand lists (OpenAI/Perplexity web search).
results.li2: Alternative comparisons with criteria, sentiment and confidence level.
results.li3: Structured responses via AIResponse (rankings, mentions, sources).

map.title: Mapping to modules
map.perplexity: Competitor pipeline Perplexity → OpenAI structured conversion:

more.title: Go further
more.p1: See <prompts>Writing effective prompts</prompts> and <lecture>Read and interpret results</lecture> to maximize relevance and interpretation.

prompts.title: Writing effective prompts
prompts.p1: Prompts should be specific, separated by intent and aligned with expected output structures (AIResponse). Use measurable criteria and market context to guide web search.

types.title: Request types (aligned with PROMPT_TEMPLATES)
types.ranking: <0>Ranking</0> — “top {industry} in {year}”; aims for comparable lists suitable for <1>rankings</1>.

tech.title: Technical options
tech.li1: Web search: enable useWebSearch for OpenAI — see OpenAI Web Search.
tech.li2: Models: favor gpt-4o-mini (cost/latency) and switch to gpt-4o if needed.
tech.li3: Scope: specify country/region, segment and company size to guide search.

best.title: Best practices
best.li1: Define 3–5 measurable criteria and context (market, country, target).
best.li2: Separate discovery, comparison and recommendation into distinct prompts.
best.li3: Limit to 5 options to ease decision making.

lecture.title: Read and interpret results
lecture.p1: Results are structured around AIResponse and derivatives (CompanyRanking, etc.). Here’s how to interpret the key sections.

structure.title: AIResponse structure (extracts)
structure.li2: rankings: list of CompanyRanking (position, company, sentiment).
structure.li5: sentiment, confidence: mood summary and confidence.
structure.li6: webSearchSources: sources from web search (if enabled).

rankings.title: Interpreting rankings
rankings.p1: Positions come from structured analysis of the generated text. Detection uses intelligent brand variations to reduce false negatives.

sources.title: Web search sources
sources.p1: If web search is enabled, URLs may be extracted from several OpenAI response fields (alternate paths, annotations) and directly from text (“Sources consulted”). Use these sources to audit freshness and reliability.

scores.title: Scores and matrices
scores.li1: Prompts and Responses: This tab displays the prompts used for analysis as well as the different responses generated by each AI. This allows you to see how each AI model interprets and responds to the questions asked.
scores.li2: Comparison Matrix: The comparison matrix allows you to visualize your brand's position relative to competitors in terms of visibility. Percentages are calculated based on the number of mentions of each brand in responses relative to the total number of responses. This helps you identify your brand's strengths and weaknesses against the competition.
scores.li3: Brand Rankings: This ranking shows the position of your brand and competitors in the market. Scores are based on each brand's visibility in responses generated by different AIs. This gives you an idea of your brand's recognition compared to other market players.
scores.li4: Visibility Score: The visibility score measures your brand's online presence. It is calculated based on the number of mentions across all AIs as well as the average sentiment attributed. A high score indicates increased positive visibility of your brand online. This allows you to track the evolution of your brand's perception on the web.

credits.title: Credit consumption
credits.p1: Credits are consumed during the following operations: scraping, web search, AI calls (generation, structured conversion). Cost depends on models, context lengths, and search depth.

rules.title: Rules per action (Brand Monitor)
rules.li4: Prompt analysis (WebSearch ON): {perPromptWeb} credits per prompt
rules.li5: Prompt analysis (WebSearch OFF): {perPromptNoWeb} credit per prompt

factors.title: Influencing factors
factors.li1: OpenAI web search: adds token cost (responses + source extraction).
factors.li2: Perplexity competitor pipeline: Perplexity cost + OpenAI structured conversion.

orders.title: Orders of magnitude
orders.li3: Extended web search + structuring: higher cost.

tracking.title: Tracking
tracking.p1: The credit counter is visible in the dashboard with threshold alerts.

ui.title: UI behaviors
ui.li1: Buttons remain clickable: an error appears if credits are insufficient.
ui.li2: Web Search button tooltip: {perPromptWeb} or {perPromptNoWeb} credit(s) per prompt depending on state.
ui.li3: Add Prompt is always allowed (no credit check upfront).
ui.li4: Start Analysis checks dynamically: prompts × (1 or 2 depending on WebSearch).

recharge.title: Recharge credits
recharge.p1: You can top up credits at any time from the plans page. Purchases are immediate and credits become available instantly after secure payment.
recharge.p2: Go to <plans>Plans & Pricing</plans> to choose the offer suited to your usage.

best.title: Management best practices
best.li1: Schedule heavy analyses (web search + structuring) during off-peak periods.
best.li2: Separate discovery, comparison and recommendation into distinct runs.
best.li3: Monitor threshold alerts to anticipate top-ups.

openai.title: OpenAI Web Search
openai.intro: This section documents the OpenAI web search integration via the Responses API and the web_search tool. It covers the technical flow, code integration, configuration, error handling, and test examples.

overview.li1: OpenAI Responses integration with the web_search tool.
overview.li2: Robust source extraction (multiple response paths supported).
overview.li3: Structured analysis of output text (brand/competitor detection, ranking, sentiment).
overview.li4: Controlled fallbacks (model, missing API key, auth errors).

flow.title: Technical flow (summary)
flow.li1: UI enables useWebSearch for the OpenAI provider.
flow.li2: analyzePromptWithOpenAIWebSearch builds a reinforced prompt ("Sources consulted" section).
flow.li3: Call client.responses.create with tools: [{ type: "web_search" }] and max_output_tokens.
flow.li4: Check output_text then extract sources via known fields, annotations and URLs in text.
flow.li5: Call structured analysis via chat.completions.create to produce rankings/sentiment/mentions.
flow.li6: Enhanced brand detection via intelligent variations (normalization and AI if multi-word).
flow.li7: Return an AIResponse object including webSearchSources.

code.title: Integration examples
code.call1: Direct call to OpenAI Web Search implementation:

errors.title: Error handling and fallbacks
errors.li1: Missing key: if OPENAI_API_KEY is absent → exception during client initialization.
errors.li2: Unsupported model: switch to gpt-4o-mini. Supported: gpt-4o, gpt-4o-mini.
errors.li3: Auth errors (401, invalid_api_key): function returns null to ignore this provider.
errors.li4: Empty response: throws explicit "empty response" error.
errors.li5: Structured analysis failed: fallback to textual analysis with variation-based detection.

tests.title: Tests & validation
tests.li2: Extraction of at least 1–3 webSearchSources when relevant.
tests.li3: Structured fields (rankings, sentiment, mentions) consistent with the response.

faq.title: Frequently asked questions
faq.description: Everything you need to know about VOXUM Monitor

howItWorks.question: How does VOXUM Monitor work?
howItWorks.answer: VOXUM Monitor analyzes your brand's visibility across major AI platforms like ChatGPT, Claude, and Perplexity. Simply enter your website URL, and we'll show you how AI models rank your brand against competitors, what prompts trigger your appearance, and provide actionable insights to improve your AI visibility.

providers.question: Which AI providers do you monitor?
providers.answer: We monitor all major AI platforms including OpenAI's ChatGPT, Anthropic's Claude, Perplexity, Google's Gemini, and more. Our system continuously updates as new AI providers emerge, ensuring you always have comprehensive visibility across the AI landscape.

updates.question: How often is the data updated?
updates.answer: Our monitoring runs in real-time. When you request an analysis, we query all AI providers simultaneously to get the most current results. You can run new analyses anytime to track changes in your brand visibility and see how your optimization efforts are performing.

insights.question: What insights will I get?
insights.answer: You'll see your brand's visibility score, competitor rankings, which prompts trigger your appearance, response quality analysis, and specific recommendations to improve your AI presence. The platform also tracks trends over time and alerts you to significant changes.

credits.question: How many credits do I need?
credits.answer: Credits are consumed dynamically per action. Count 1 credit for the initial URL analysis and 2 credits per analyzed prompt (with potential additional costs depending on your actions). For example, 8 prompts will cost 16 credits (excluding URL).

finalCta.title: Start Monitoring Your AI Brand Visibility
finalCta.description: Take control of how AI models present your brand

companyExtraction.instruction: Extract company information from this website content:
companyExtraction.extractDescription: Extract the company name, a brief description, relevant keywords, and identify the PRIMARY industry category.
companyExtraction.industryRulesCoolers: If the company makes coolers, drinkware, outdoor equipment, camping gear, categorize as "outdoor gear"
companyExtraction.industryRulesWebScraping: If the company offers web scraping, crawling, data extraction, or HTML parsing tools/services, categorize as "web scraping"
companyExtraction.industryRulesAI: If the company primarily provides AI/ML models or services, categorize as "AI"
companyExtraction.industryRulesDeployment: If the company offers hosting, deployment, or cloud infrastructure, categorize as "deployment"
companyExtraction.industryRulesEcommerce: If the company is an e-commerce platform or online store builder, categorize as "e-commerce platform"
companyExtraction.industryRulesDirectConsumer: If the company sells physical products directly to consumers (clothing, accessories, etc.), categorize as "direct-to-consumer brand"
companyExtraction.industryRulesApparel: If the company is in fashion/apparel/underwear/clothing, categorize as "apparel & fashion"
companyExtraction.industryRulesDeveloper: If the company provides software tools or APIs, categorize as "developer tools"
companyExtraction.industryRulesMarketplace: If the company is a marketplace or aggregator, categorize as "marketplace"
companyExtraction.industryRulesConsumer: For other consumer products, use "consumer goods"
companyExtraction.mainProductsNote: For mainProducts, list the ACTUAL PRODUCTS (e.g., "coolers", "tumblers", "drinkware") not product categories
companyExtraction.competitorsNote: For competitors, extract FULL COMPANY NAMES (e.g., "RTIC", "IGLOO", "Coleman") not just initials
companyExtraction.focusNote: Focus on what the company MAKES/SELLS, not what goes IN their products (e.g., Yeti makes coolers, not beverages)
companyExtraction.nameExtractionTitle: CRITICAL INSTRUCTIONS FOR COMPANY NAME EXTRACTION:
companyExtraction.nameExtraction1: Extract the COMPLETE and EXACT company name as it appears officially on the website
companyExtraction.nameExtraction2: PRESERVE ALL characters including: numbers, letters, special characters, spaces, punctuation
companyExtraction.nameExtraction3: DO NOT abbreviate, truncate, or modify any part of the name
companyExtraction.nameExtraction4: DO NOT remove letters or numbers that might seem redundant
companyExtraction.nameExtraction5: Look for the name in multiple places: page title, header, footer, contact info, about section
companyExtraction.nameExtraction6: If multiple variations exist, choose the most complete and official version
companyExtraction.namePrecisionNote: The company name MUST be extracted with absolute precision - every character matters

analysisPrompt.analyzeResponse: Analyze this AI response about {brandName} and competitors {competitors}:
analysisPrompt.questionPosition: What position/ranking does it have? (number or "not ranked")

prompts.webSearchDesc: Enable the webSearch toggle to allow the tool to perform online searches and get up-to-date information. This can improve the accuracy of recommendations by using the most recent data available.
prompts.modelsDesc: Favor gpt-4o-mini (cost/latency) and switch to gpt-4o if needed.
prompts.scopeDesc: Specify country/region, segment and company size to guide the search.

common.title: Voxum by MAJ Digital
common.description: AI models like GPT and Perplexity are new brand influencers. Our platform helps you monitor, analyze, and optimize how your brand appears in conversational AI — essential for your Generative Engine Optimization (GEO) strategy.
